verses.verse: Thus the heavens <S%H8064><s%> and the earth <S%H776><s%> were completed, <S%H3615><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> their hosts. <S%H6635><s%>

And by the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> God <S%H430><s%> completed <S%H3615><s%> His work <S%H4399><s%> which <S%H834><s%> He had done; <S%H6213><s%> and He rested <S%H7673><s%> on the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> from all <S%H3605><s%> His work <S%H4399><s%> which <S%H834><s%> He had done. <S%H6213><s%>

Then God <S%H430><s%> blessed <S%H1288><s%> the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> and sanctified <S%H6942><s%> it, because <S%H3588><s%> in it He rested <S%H7673><s%> from all <S%H3605><s%> His work <S%H4399><s%> which <S%H834><s%> God <S%H430><s%> had created <S%H1254><s%> and made. <S%H6213><s%>

This <S%H428><s%> is the account <S%H8435><s%> of the heavens <S%H8064><s%> and the earth <S%H776><s%> when they were created, <S%H1254><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> that the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> earth <S%H776><s%> and heaven. <S%H8064><s%>

Now no <S%H2962><s%> <S%H3605><s%> shrub <S%H7880><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> was yet <S%H2962><s%> in the earth, <S%H776><s%> and no <S%H2962><s%> <S%H3605><s%> plant <S%H6212><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> had yet <S%H2962><s%> sprouted, <S%H6779><s%> for the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> had not sent <S%H4305><s%> rain <S%H4305><s%> upon the earth; <S%H776><s%> and there was no <S%H369><s%> man <S%H120><s%> to cultivate <S%H5647><s%> the ground. <S%H127><s%>
But a mist <S%H108><s%> used to rise <S%H5927><s%> from the earth <S%H776><s%> and water <S%H8248><s%> the whole <S%H3605><s%> surface <S%H6440><s%> of the ground. <S%H127><s%>

Then the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> formed <S%H3335><s%> man <S%H120><s%> of dust <S%H6083><s%> from the ground, <S%H127><s%> and breathed <S%H5301><s%> into his nostrils <S%H639><s%> the breath <S%H5397><s%> of life; <S%H9132><s%> and man <S%H120><s%> became <S%H1961><s%> a living <S%H2416><s%> being. <S%H5315><s%>

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> planted <S%H5193><s%> a garden <S%H1588><s%> toward <S%H4480><s%> the east, <S%H6924><s%> in Eden; <S%H5731><s%> and there <S%H8033><s%> He placed <S%H7760><s%> the man <S%H120><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> He had formed. <S%H3335><s%>

And out of the ground <S%H127><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> caused to grow <S%H6779><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> tree <S%H6086><s%> that is pleasing <S%H2530><s%> to the sight <S%H4758><s%> and good <S%H2896><s%> for food; <S%H3978><s%> the tree <S%H6086><s%> of life <S%H9132><s%> also in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of the garden, <S%H1588><s%> and the tree <S%H6086><s%> of the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of good <S%H9185><s%> and evil. <S%H9563><s%>

Now a river <S%H5104><s%> flowed <S%H3318><s%> out of Eden <S%H5731><s%> to water <S%H8248><s%> the garden; <S%H1588><s%> and from there <S%H8033><s%> it divided <S%H6504><s%> and became <S%H1961><s%> four <S%H702><s%> rivers. <S%H7218><s%>

The name <S%H8034><s%> of the first <S%H259><s%> is Pishon; <S%H6376><s%> it flows <S%H5437><s%> around <S%H5437><s%> the whole <S%H3605><s%> land <S%H776><s%> of Havilah, <S%H2341><s%> where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> is gold. <S%H2091><s%>
And the gold <S%H2091><s%> of that land <S%H776><s%> is good; <S%H2896><s%> the bdellium <S%H916><s%> and the onyx <S%H7718><s%> stone <S%H68><s%> are there. <S%H8033><s%>

And the name <S%H8034><s%> of the second <S%H8145><s%> river <S%H5104><s%> is Gihon; <S%H1521><s%> it flows <S%H5437><s%> around <S%H5437><s%> the whole <S%H3605><s%> land <S%H776><s%> of Cush. <S%H3568><s%>

And the name <S%H8034><s%> of the third <S%H7992><s%> river <S%H5104><s%> is Tigris; <S%H2313><s%> it flows <S%H1980><s%> east <S%H6926><s%> of Assyria. <S%H804><s%> And the fourth <S%H7243><s%> river <S%H5104><s%> is the Euphrates. <S%H6578><s%>

Then the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> the man <S%H120><s%> and put <S%H5117><s%> him into the garden <S%H1588><s%> of Eden <S%H5731><s%> to cultivate <S%H5647><s%> it and keep <S%H8104><s%> it.

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> commanded <S%H6680><s%> the man, <S%H120><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "From any <S%H3605><s%> tree <S%H6086><s%> of the garden <S%H1588><s%> you may eat <S%H398><s%> freely; <S%H398><s%>

but from the tree <S%H6086><s%> of the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of good <S%H9185><s%> and evil <S%H9563><s%> you shall not eat, <S%H398><s%> for in the day <S%H3117><s%> that you eat <S%H398><s%> from it you shall surely <S%H4191><s%> die. <S%H4191><s%> "

Then the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "It is not good <S%H2896><s%> for the man <S%H120><s%> to be alone; <S%H905><s%> I will make <S%H6213><s%> him a helper <S%H5828><s%> suitable <S%H5048><s%> for him."

And out of the ground <S%H127><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> formed <S%H3335><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> beast <S%H9130><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> and every <S%H3605><s%> bird <S%H5775><s%> of the sky, <S%H8064><s%> and brought <S%H935><s%> [them] to the man <S%H120><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> he would call <S%H7121><s%> them; and whatever <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> the man <S%H120><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> a living <S%H2416><s%> creature, <S%H5315><s%> that was its name. <S%H8034><s%>

And the man <S%H120><s%> gave <S%H7121><s%> names <S%H8034><s%> to all <S%H3605><s%> the cattle, <S%H929><s%> and to the birds <S%H5775><s%> of the sky, <S%H8064><s%> and to every <S%H3605><s%> beast <S%H9130><s%> of the field, <S%H7704><s%> but for Adam <S%H121><s%> there was not found <S%H4672><s%> a helper <S%H5828><s%> suitable <S%H5048><s%> for him.

So the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> caused a deep <S%H8639><s%> sleep <S%H8639><s%> to fall <S%H5307><s%> upon the man, <S%H120><s%> and he slept; <S%H3462><s%> then He took <S%H3947><s%> one <S%H259><s%> of his ribs, <S%H6763><s%> and closed <S%H5462><s%> up the flesh <S%H1320><s%> at that place. <S%H8478><s%>

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> fashioned <S%H1129><s%> into a woman <S%H802><s%> the rib <S%H6763><s%> which <S%H834><s%> He had taken <S%H3947><s%> from the man, <S%H120><s%> and brought <S%H935><s%> her to the man. <S%H120><s%>

And the man <S%H120><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "This <S%H2088><s%> is now <S%H6471><s%> bone <S%H6106><s%> of my bones, <S%H6106><s%> And flesh <S%H1320><s%> of my flesh; <S%H1320><s%> She shall be called <S%H7121><s%> Woman, <S%H802><s%> Because <S%H3588><s%> she was taken <S%H3947><s%> out of Man. <S%H376><s%>"

For this <S%H3651><s%> cause <S%H5921><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> shall leave <S%H5800><s%> his father and his mother, <S%H1><s%> and shall cleave <S%H517><s%> to his wife; <S%H1692><s%> and they shall become <S%H802><s%> one <S%H1961><s%> flesh. <S%H259><s%>
And the man <S%H120><s%> and his wife <S%H802><s%> were both <S%H8147><s%> naked <S%H6174><s%> and were not ashamed. <S%H954><s%>
